articles.headline: Move Over, Bitcoin. Ether Is the Digital Currency of the Moment.
articles.snippet: Ethereum, a digital currency network that is winning over tech geeks and big companies, may soon surpass Bitcoin, its inspiration. Or it may fizzle.
articles.abstract: Ethereum, a digital currency network that is winning over tech geeks and big companies, may soon surpass Bitcoin, its inspiration. Or it may fizzle.
articles.lead_paragraph: The price of Bitcoin has hit record highs in recent months, more than doubling in price since the start of the year. Despite these gains, Bitcoin is on the verge of losing its position as the dominant virtual currency.

articles.headline: An Attack on Muslims Shakes Cosmopolitan London
articles.snippet: This proudly diverse and tolerant city is now confronted with the tensions and ugliness that have been simmering on the fringes for years and are boiling to the surface.
articles.abstract: This proudly diverse and tolerant city is now confronted with the tensions and ugliness that have been simmering on the fringes for years and are boiling to the surface.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Like many of London’s Muslims, Mohammed Abdullah grew tired of defending himself, and his religion, after Islamist terrorists carried out two attacks in the city and another in Manchester during the past three months. Hostile glances followed him on the street, and rising fury greeted him on social media.

articles.headline: Conglomerates Didn’t Die. They Look Like Amazon.
articles.snippet: Just as investors were mourning the demise of the old-style conglomerate, Jeff Bezos’ company announced it would stretch its boundaries by buying Whole Foods.
articles.abstract: Just as investors were mourning the demise of the old-style conglomerate, Jeff Bezos’ company announced it would stretch its boundaries by buying Whole Foods.
articles.lead_paragraph: The conglomerate was supposed to be dead, a relic of a bygone era of corporate America. Investors, we have been repeatedly told, want smaller, nimbler, more focused companies.

articles.headline: 7 Sailors Emerged From Diverse Backgrounds to Pursue a Common Cause
articles.snippet: The group of sailors who died on Saturday represented today’s military, which heavily recruits in immigrant communities from coast to coast.
articles.abstract: The group of sailors who died on Saturday represented today’s military, which heavily recruits in immigrant communities from coast to coast.
articles.lead_paragraph: The seven sailors who died when the destroyer Fitzgerald collided with a container ship last weekend were a snapshot of the nation they served: an immigrant from the Philippines whose father served in the Navy before him; a poor teenager whose Guatemalan family came north eager for opportunity; a native of Vietnam hoping to help his family; a firefighter’s son from a rural crossroads in the rolling green fields of Virginia.

articles.headline: Barclays and Former Executives Charged in Qatar Fund-Raising
articles.snippet: The criminal charges against the British bank and four former executives take aim at how it avoided a government bailout during the financial crisis.
articles.abstract: The criminal charges against the British bank and four former executives take aim at how it avoided a government bailout during the financial crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — With two capital infusions in 2008, Barclays was able to survive the financial crisis without a government bailout even as other British banks teetered.

articles.headline: Netflix Lets Viewers Pick the Plot
articles.snippet: A new episode of “The Adventures of Puss in Boots,” an animated show, includes interactive elements that will result in different story lines.
articles.abstract: A new episode of “The Adventures of Puss in Boots,” an animated show, includes interactive elements that will result in different story lines.
articles.lead_paragraph: Attention, kids: Netflix just put you in charge.

articles.headline: Haven for Recovering Addicts Now Profits From Their Relapses
articles.snippet: Delray Beach, Fla., was once a godsend for substance abusers. But now, a sprawl of fraudulent outpatient centers capitalize on addicts’ thwarted recoveries.
articles.abstract: Delray Beach, Fla., was once a godsend for substance abusers. But now, a sprawl of fraudulent outpatient centers capitalize on addicts’ thwarted recoveries.
articles.lead_paragraph: DELRAY BEACH, Fla. — It was the kind of afternoon that cold-weary tourists revel in as they sip mojitos near the beach — a dazzling sun, a sky so blue it verged on Photoshopped and weather fit for flip-flops. But the young visitor from Arkansas, curled up into a ball near the sidewalk, had a better reason to be grateful. He was alive.
